commit_message:
run_test.sh -V --unit doesn't run using virtualenv

Before this change, when you called the script using the -V option, the tests
were run outside the virtualenv that the script creates.
To fix it, I modified the lines of the script that run the tests to run
inside the virtualenv using the $wrapper variable.

Change-Id: I5c202727e0b5214670d54e14c80a68cc8ebec400
Closes-Bug: #1251730
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/78/59378/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix OSTF in IE

IE caches ajax result and this leads to wrong data, obtained in calculations - preventing cache for IE

Change-Id: Id837f02595c67c4bcfdbb23d8a4014b629414539
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/29/59929/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (isExplorer.exec(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase())) { // this is needed for IE, which caches requests resulting in wrong results (e.g /ostf/testruns/last/1) $.ajaxSetup({ cache: false }); }

commit_message:
Multi-backend

Multi backend implementation using the composite pattern. The
multi-backend is its own self-contained backend that simply dispatches
all methods to a master and a slave backend, with ordering described in
MultiBackend's docstring.

Change-Id: Ibe2790471aa0fc37dcf874e3030d73d5abee1d62
Implements: blueprint multi-backend

added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2013 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Artom Lifshitz <artom.lifshitz@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from designate import backend from designate import exceptions from designate.plugin import Plugin from designate.backend import base from oslo.config import cfg import logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CFG_GRP = 'backend:multi' cfg.CONF.register_group(cfg.OptGroup( name=CFG_GRP, title="Configuration for multi-backend Backend" )) cfg.CONF.register_opts([ cfg.ListOpst('backends', default='fake', help='Comma-separated list of backends to load'), ], group=CFG_GRP) class MultiBackend(base.Backend): __plugin_name__ = 'multi' def __init__(self, central_service): super(MultiBackend, self).__init__(central_service) self.backends = [backend.get_backend(name, central_service) for name in cfg.CONF[CFG_GRP].backends] def all_backends(self, method_name, *args): ''' Calls backend.method_name(*args) on all backends''' for backend in self.backends: try: method = getattr(backend, method_name) method(*args) except AttributeError: LOG.debug('Attempt to call missing method %s on backend %s' % (method_name, Plugin.get_plugin_name)) except exceptions.Base as e: LOG.error('Backend %s raised %s, ' 'continuing with other backends' % (Plugin.get_plugin_name(backend), e)) def create_tsigkey(self, context, tsigkey): self.all_backends('create_tsigkey', context, tsigkey) def update_tsigkey(self, context, tsigkey): self.all_backends('update_tsigkey', context, tsigkey) def delete_tsigkey(self, context, tsigkey): self.all_backends('delete_tsigkey', context, tsigkey) def create_domain(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('create_domain', context, domain) def update_domain(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('update_domain', context, domain) def delete_domain(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('delete_domain', context, domain) def create_record(self, context, domain, record): self.all_backends('create_record', context, domain, record) def update_record(self, context, domain, record): self.all_backends('update_record', context, domain, record) def delete_record(self, context, domain, record): self.all_backends('delete_record', context, domain, record) def create_server(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('create_server', context, server) def update_server(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('update_server', context, server) def delete_server(self, context, domain): self.all_backends('delete_server', context, server) def ping(self, context): self.all_backends('ping', context) def start(self): self.all_backends('start') def stop(self): self.all_backends('stop')

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from designate.openstack.common import log as logging from sqlalchemy import MetaData, Table, Column, String from sqlalchemy.sql import select LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) meta = MetaData() def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine domains_table = Table('domains', meta, autoload=True) records_table = Table('records', meta, autoload=True) # Add the tenant_id column tenant_id = Column('tenant_id', String(36), default=None, nullable=True) tenant_id.create(records_table, populate_default=True) # Populate the tenant_id column inner_select = select([domains_table.c.tenant_id])\ .where(domains_table.c.id == records_table.c.domain_id)\ .as_scalar() records_table.update()\ .values(name=inner_select)\ .execute() def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine records_table = Table('records', meta, autoload=True) # Drop the tenant_id column records_table.c.tenant_id.drop()

commit_message:
Fix flavor names with Amazon prefix "m1"

* Remove Amazon specific prefix "m1" from flavor names.
* Amazon has the M1 prefix to denote high memory, and it also denotes
  that thhe instance created from M1 instance types are based on Intel Xeon
  processors.
* "m1" doesnt have any similar meaning in OpenStack. We dont map flavors
  to any specific hardware platform. Hence removing the prefix.

Change-Id: Id54530ea6d58d19193702c5a0af55ca7d237b3dd
Closes-Bug: #1161988

Sometimes when single test from testrun is started or restarted its
status is not updated by nose storage plugin. In those conditions
session from nose storage plugin can not access data that were provided
by session of higher level in models.py logic of parent process.
Explicitly closing parent process session before start test running
does help but some additional code modification required in
this case.

commit_message:
Fix bug with no test status updating while standalone run.

Sometimes when single test from testrun is started or restarted its
status is not updated by nose storage plugin. In those conditions
session from nose storage plugin can not access data that were provided
by session of higher level in models.py logic of parent process.
Explicitly closing parent process session before start test running
does help but some additional code modification required in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie5415963c189b66cca58986370982f814f2a7431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/70/59170/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for test_run in test_runs: test_set = test_run['testset'] metadata = test_run['metadata'] tests = test_run.get('tests', []) with request.session.begin(subtransactions=True): test_run = models.TestRun.start( request.session, test_set, metadata, tests ) res.append(test_run)
deleted_lines: with request.session.begin(subtransactions=True): for test_run in test_runs: test_set = test_run['testset'] metadata = test_run['metadata'] tests = test_run.get('tests', []) test_run = models.TestRun.start( request.session, test_set, metadata, tests ) res.append(test_run)

commit_message:
Removes check CONF.dhcp_options_enabled from nova

* Neutron supports extra_dhcp_opts since Havana
* Hence remove boolean check dhcp_options_enabled

Closes-Bug: #1214162
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9af217a87a237e078e70332cbed1c80ad4d5db0a

commit_message:
Fix i18n error when resource-name is non-english

When executing commands about event and resource with
non-english resource-name, error "'ascii' codec can't
decode byte...." will occur.

Root cause is that heatclient can not generate a correct
encoded url. This Patch will use quote and safe_encode
functions to implement a url-encode process.

Closes-Bug: #1249234
Change-Id: I4261fdaf6ccc60aebdb9df236f4eedce0f9baa14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/21/57621/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heatclient.openstack.common.py3kcompat import urlutils from heatclient.openstack.common import strutils # Use urlutils for python2/python3 compatibility url = '/stacks/%s/resources/%s/events' % ( urlutils.quote(stack_id, ''), urlutils.quote(strutils.safe_encode(resource_name), '')) # Use urlutils for python2/python3 compatibility url_str = '/stacks/%s/resources/%s/events/%s' % ( urlutils.quote(stack_id, ''), urlutils.quote(strutils.safe_encode(resource_name), ''), urlutils.quote(event_id, ''))

subject: Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 140.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-28 20:10:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bf3f66b86229a77a1981f50f381d9f83ab4aa879', 'message': 'Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations < 140.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations into a single
migration (140_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Change-Id: I0405c02191a47b96759131bf6b7a1379f4b5711e
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-30 16:22:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9f535ef7e274b2e49e75e732dc434122c97e4a85', 'message': 'Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 140.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database less <= 140 migrations into a single
migration (140_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

1) Add counters to bw_usage_cache table.

2) Add node to instances.

3) Add indexes to instances.

4) Add indexes to migrations.

5) drop server name from instances
 NOTE: for sqlite this change recreated the instances table altogether.
 This required slight changes to the 201_add_sqlite_indexes.py migration
 to account for this change since we no longer need to add indexes
 there. 140_havana has been adjusted to accomidate this via a new
 common_indexes array... which moving forward we should use instead.

6) add indexes to fixed ips.

7) Drop unused postgresql volume sequences.

Change-Id: I0405c02191a47b96759131bf6b7a1379f4b5711e
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations

commit_message:
Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 140.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 140 into a single
migration (140_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

1) Add counters to bw_usage_cache table.

2) Add node to instances.

3) Add indexes to instances.

4) Add indexes to migrations.

5) drop server name from instances
 NOTE: for sqlite this change recreated the instances table altogether.

6) add indexes to fixed ips.

7) Drop unused postgresql volume sequences.

Change-Id: I0405c02191a47b96759131bf6b7a1379f4b5711e
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations

commit_message:
Fix DB integrity issues when using postgres

The IntegrityError faced on network deletion that
spooks Tempest tests is most likely caused by the
fact that the ml2 plugin does a dirty read. By
adding a 'select for update' we should be able to
address the issue once and for all.

Also, there's a chance that the dhcp port gets
reallocated while we are deleting the network. To
this aim, catch the integrity error and attempt
to recover from it.

This patch also removes the handling of errors
on concurrent reads that can no longer occur when
deleting the network.

(Hopefully) Closes-bug: #1239637

PS: This fix may be relevant for bugs #1243726 and #1246737

Change-Id: Iefae7fc8a903cc35d8bf80fc4cee533b7f64032c
(cherry picked from commit 54d79acaab50993f08b50f21019f82f17d38caa3)
